data.description: Rockwell Automation is a global technology leader focused on helping the world’s manufacturers be more productive, sustainable, and agile. With more than 28,000 employees who make the world better every day, we know we have something special. Behind our customers - amazing companies that help feed the world, provide life-saving medicine on a global scale, and focus on clean water and green mobility - our people are energized problem solvers that take pride in how the work we do changes the world for the better.We welcome all makers, forward thinkers, and problem solvers who are looking for a place to do their best work. And if that’s you we would love to have you join us!Job DescriptionThe AI Center of Excellence (COE) at Rockwell Automation is seeking a self-driven Intern to contribute to the development of learning-enabled control solutions for complex, nonlinear dynamical systems. You will work closely with AI COE researchers and engineers on applying deep learning and modern control techniques to real-world industrial systems.This internship offers hands-on exposure to state-of-the-art AI for control, bridging theory and deployment in industrial environments.Your Responsibilities:Develop and evaluate AI-driven control and system identification methods for nonlinear dynamical systemsApply learning techniques to improve control performance and robustnessCollaborate with researchers and engineers on prototyping, experimentation, and analysisDocument and communicate technical findings clearlyThe Essentials - You Will Have:Currently pursuing a bachelors or advanced degree from an accredited college or university.The Preferred - You Might Also Have:Strong foundation in control theory and system identification (e.g., Koopman-based methods, MPC)Solid understanding of machine learning and deep learningProficiency in PythonExperience with ML/DL frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras)Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skillsExposure to MLOps concepts and toolsFamiliarity with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)Front-end or visualization experience (e.g., React, Angular, Vue) is a plusWhat We Offer:Health Insurance including Medical, Dental and Vision401kPaid Holidays offFlexible Work Schedule where you will work with your manager to enjoy a work schedule that can be flexible with your personal life.To learn more about our benefits package, please visit at www.raquickfind.com.At Rockwell Automation we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you're excited about this role but your experience doesn't align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right person for this or other roles.This position is part of a job family. Experience will be the determining factor for position level and compensation.#LI-DNIFor this role, the Base Salary Compensation is from $22/hour - $40/hour. Our benefits for the US can be found here. Actual pay will be based on factors such as skills, knowledge, education, and experience.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans. If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at +1 (844) 404-7247.Rockwell Automation’s hybrid policy aligns that employees are expected to work at a Rockwell location at least Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays unless they have a business obligation out of the office.
